title: How to Make Lavender Wash Balls

steps.headline: Sift the orris root powder and lavender flower powder through a fine sieve.
Mix all of the ingredients together in a large bowl.
Add the rosewater to create a stiff paste.
steps.description: It should be pliable; continue adding rosewater until this consistency is reached.

steps.headline: Roll into ball shapes about the size of a golf ball or slightly larger if desired.
Set out a sheet of wax paper on a baking tray.
Place each wash ball on the tray and put another sheet of wax paper over the top.
Put the tray of drying wash balls into a dark, dry cupboard to set.
steps.description: The wash balls should be left to set for at least two - three weeks.

steps.headline: Check to see if they are dry.
steps.description: Once dry, wrap in individual wax paper and store for use.

text: Grate the soap into shavings.  Sift the orris root powder and lavender flower powder through a fine sieve.  Mix all of the ingredients together in a large bowl.  Add the rosewater to create a stiff paste. It should be pliable; continue adding rosewater until this consistency is reached. Roll into ball shapes about the size of a golf ball or slightly larger if desired.  Set out a sheet of wax paper on a baking tray.  Place each wash ball on the tray and put another sheet of wax paper over the top.  Put the tray of drying wash balls into a dark, dry cupboard to set. The wash balls should be left to set for at least two - three weeks. Check to see if they are dry. Once dry, wrap in individual wax paper and store for use.
